comment.author: 49503202796@N01
comment._content: I wonder what they fed it, since koalas live off of eucalyptus leaves, which probably wouldn't be available in a war zone.

comment.author: 15573720@N00
comment._content: I imagine that this photo was taken in Australia.  Koalas are high maintenance animals if kept in captivity in Australia, let alone overseas!

comment.author: 34427469121@N01
comment._content: You can see over on the right there that this photo was taken in Broadmeadows, Melbourne, Australia.

comment.author: 30115723@N02
comment._content: A few koalas did make it overseas as mascots. I have often wondered about their food, but eucalyptus tres do exist outside Australia so perhaps they were of the right type. if they took eucalyptus leaves with them on the ship transporting them, they must have been pretty dry by the time they got over there.
